thread.title: Saints acquire tight end Hoomanawanui from Patriots
thread.title_full: Saints acquire tight end Hoomanawanui from Patriots

title: Saints acquire tight end Hoomanawanui from Patriots
text:
Saints acquire Michael Hoomanawanui from Patriots New Orleans trades defensive end Akiem Hicks for tight end Published 8:44 PM CDT Sep 30, 2015 A Large Text Photos 
The New Orleans Saints announced Wednesday they have acquired tight end Michael Hoomanawanui from the New England Patriots in exchange for defensive end Akiem Hicks. Related Landrieu, Sewerage and Water Board... 
Hoomanawanui was a fifth-round draft pick of the St. Louis Rams (132nd overall) in 2010 out of Illinois. The six-year NFL veteran has appeared in 61 career games with 39 starts and had recorded 40 receptions for 518 yards with four touchdowns. 
Signed by New England in 2012 after spending his first two seasons with the Rams, Hoomanawanui appeared in all 16 regular season games with 12 starts for the Super Bowl XLIX champions in 2014, recording three receptions for 44 yards. He played in all three postseason games with two starts and had six receptions for 53 yards. 
Hicks, was selected by New Orleans in the third round of the 2012 NFL draft out of Regina College. He played in 48 games with 33 starts and recorded 164 tackles, 6.5 sacks, three passes defensed and one forced fumble.
